data.title: The secret's in the love letters: Joanna Lumley on the key to her 37 year-marriage
data.meta_description: She is set to celebrate her 37th wedding anniversary to her current husband, conductor Stephen Barlow later this year.
data.text:
Joanna Lumley is married to Stephen Barlow, and later this year, they will celebrate 37 years together.

The actor shared the secret to their long-lasting marriage that includes an old tradition.

She also shared that the importance of respect and being friends is key to a relationship.

The 76-year-old 'Absolutely Fabulous' star Joanna Lumley has had her fair share of love affairs. She was briefly married to actor Jeremy Lloyd in the 70s and had son James from her relationship with photographer Michael Claydon.

She is set to celebrate her 37th wedding anniversary to her current husband, conductor Stephen Barlow later this year. And according to Lumley, it's the love notes they exchange that's been one of the keys to their long relationship.

READ MORE | Radio star reveals the fun way Will Smith helped him propose – 'His idea was pretty epic'

In the new issue of Yours Magazine, she says, "Stephen and I are forever writing notes. When I'm on the other side of the world, in faraway lands, we write to each other. People say, 'Who writes letters anymore?' And I say, 'I do!' I think that's been really important for our marriage."

She also spoke about the importance of respect and being friends in a relationship. "They say the secret to a long marriage is not to get divorced – a perfect answer."

READ MORE | WATCH | Angela Bassett celebrates 25th anniversary with Courtney B. Vance - 'We've always had each other'

"But the real secret is starting off with respect. Don't marry someone if you don't respect them – know that you admire them for what they do and who they are. Have courtesy and be kind to your partner. Stephen and I love and respect each other, and I think that's what you need. The second most important thing is that they must be your best friend. Your real go-to and trusted friend."

READ MORE | Michelle and Barack Obama share sweet love notes to mark 30 years together - 'I won the lottery'

Joanna also admitted to being starstruck by the prospect of working with Leonardo DiCaprio, with who she starred in 'The Wolf of Wall Street'.

"My heart did beat a little faster at the thought of working with him. And he couldn't have been sweeter or more courteous. I was afraid he may be a bit of a Hollywood brat, but he turned out to be the sweetest, most modest, kind-hearted, good-natured, humble, adorable man."
